page.title: 05Religion
page.content: St.Martin's Church is the parent church of Seamer,Irton,Crossgates and East Ayton.St.Martin's has an organis- ation called the"Porochial Church Council".This council meets once a month.Any person may be buried in St. Martin's churchyard but Â£100 is asked for annually for the upkeep of the churchyard.Every second Sunday of the month the vicar perform baptisms, weddings and funerals.Every Sunday there are two services performed, the first at 8a.m.,the second at 10.45a.m. Some elderly people cannot manage to get to these services so during the week "house communions" take place and the vicar goes to a house and performs the service.The church has a "Womens group" who visit the sick. The vicar visits the sick,bereaved and those get ting married.The church has a Sunday School and a fund raising committee.
